data.description:
Borderless is a non-for-profit tech arm of Crypto Smart that aims to train at least 100 African tech developers each year to build Web2 and Web3 products. We do this by establishing physical hubs, hosting events, providing training, offering mentorship, and launching tech projects.

Physical hubs: B<>rder/ess will have physical hubs in several African countries that provide a space for developers to learn, collaborate, and network.

The first was opened in November 2022 in Port-Harcourt Nigeria and the next will be opened at the University Of Port-Harcourt Nigeria.

Events: B<>rder/ess hosts a variety of events, such as hackathons, meetups, and conferences. These events provide developers with opportunities to learn new skills, meet new people, and share their work, the last event was held in November 2022 in Port-Harcourt Nigeria. See the highlights here https://borderless.cryptosmartnow.io/event

Training: B<>rder/ess offers a variety of training programs, both online and in person. These programs cover a wide range of topics, including web development, blockchain development, and data science.

Mentorship: B<>rder/ess pairs developers with experienced mentors. These mentors provide guidance and support to help developers reach their full potential.
data.title: Borderless
Borderless Yield
data.description: Borderless Yield is an open-source, decentralized platform that enables diaspora communities to invest small amounts in local businesses and individuals using local stablecoins (like $cKES, $cCOP, $cNGN). Rather than just sending remittances, users can support their home economies while earning returns, creating a cycle of sustainable financial empowerment.
data.problem:
Traditional remittances:

Are costly (fees up to 10%)

Don’t generate long-term impact (money is spent, not grown)

Lack transparency and tracking

Often bypass local banking systems

Meanwhile:

Local entrepreneurs lack access to fair, fast capital

Savings in local currencies are eroded by high inflation
data.solution:
A cross-border investment and lending platform built on local stablecoins that allows:

Diaspora to lend, invest, or donate directly to verified recipients

Local borrowers to access micro-loans or funding in native stablecoins

Smart contracts to automate repayments and yield distribution

Inflation-protected saving options using DeFi or stable yield pools

All powered by:

Local stablecoins (e.g., $cKES, $cCOP)

Transparent smart contracts

User-friendly dashboards for both investors and recipients
data.missionSummary: To transform remittances into productive investments, giving the global diaspora the tools to empower local communities, promote financial inclusion, and earn sustainable returns—all using stable, borderless digital currencies.
data.locationOfImpact: Primary Focus: Kenya, Nigeria, and Colombia  Diaspora Hubs: UK, US, UAE, Spain, and Canada (where most remittances originate)  Future Expansion: Latin America, East Africa, Southeast Asia
data.businessModel: 1. Revenue Streams:  Transaction Fees: Small fee (e.g., 1%) on successful investments or loan repayments  Yield Spread: A portion of the interest or yield generated from DeFi or pooled lending  Premium Features: Optional analytics, credit scoring insights, or faster withdrawals for power users  Partner Integration Fees: APIs for NGOs, MFIs, or fintechs who want to use the platform infrastructure  2. Users:  Diaspora Investors: Looking to earn and make impact at home  Local Borrowers/Entrepreneurs: Seeking small capital in their native stablecoin  Partners: NGOs, remittance companies, microfinance platforms, and crypto wallets  3. Value Proposition:  For investors: Earn interest + impact  For locals: Access affordable capital  For partners: Plug-and-play infrastructure for stablecoin finance  4. Growth Strategy:  Target remittance corridors with active crypto users (e.g., US → Kenya)  Partner with local community orgs and fintechs  Launch referral/incentive programs using stablecoins

data.description:
## INTRODUCTION 
Borderless Tech Club, Uniport is a subset of the B<>rder/ess Dev Hub. This club was created with the aim of training, equipping and empowering young persons in the University of Port Harcourt with Web3 Education, onboarding and in-demand Tech skills.

The Club was established in 2023 and since inception, Borderless UNIPORT, has been very instrumental in the Web3 Education of the University Students. This is the foremost Tech Club in the university when it comes to Web3 onboarding. Annually, over 20 students in Uniport graduate from our cipher sessions where they learn in demand Tech and Web3 skills which includes; Data Analysis, Smart Contract Development, Solidity, Web Development, UI/IX, Cyber Security etc.

### PROJECT OBJECTIVES
1. To Establish a Tech Hub within University is Port Harcourt, providing students with a physical hub for hands-on learning, collaboration, and mentorship in tech and Web3.

2. Enhance Blockchain and Tech Education by hosting regular workshops, hackathons, and training sessions. And by going on air weekly, with the school's radio station to onboard the occupied students who can't come to our hub.

3. Acquire Relevant Facilities (like Projector, Generator etc.) for onsite onboarding at the respective faculties and departments as well as public places like the school’s convocation arena.

4. Increase Community Engagement by expanding partnerships with local and global blockchain/Web3 communities.

5. Bridge the Knowledge Gap by offering structured programs in Web Development, Solidity, UI/UX design, Data Analysis,, cybersecurity, Digital Marketing and other tech-related tracks.

6. Foster Innovation and Startups by inspiring and supporting student-led Web3 and tech projects through mentorship and incubation.


### PROJECT SCOPE & IMPLEMENTATION
# Phase 1: Securing a Space for the Tech Hub
- Partner with the university administration to allocate a dedicated building for the hub.
- Equip the hub with computers, desk and chairs, internet access, and learning materials.
- Design an operational structure, including scheduled training programs.

# Phase 2: Training & Community Building
- Organize weekly training sessions on blockchain development, Web3 inclusion, smart contracts, and Web3 security.
- Invite Web3 and Tech industry experts for mentorship and coaching sessions.
- Host quarterly hackathons and bootcamps to encourage project development.

# Phase 3: Expanding Impact & Sustainability
- Strengthen collaborations with existing tech and blockchain communities.
- Launch a student-led project incubation program within the University.
- Develop a system for membership and alumni engagement.


# OUR IMPACT
As a Tech Club we have an active WhatsApp community of 240 UNIPORT Students we have onboarded into the Web3 Space. We do this via:

- Hosting Virtual Onboarding Sessions on X Spaces. Here is a few links to the X Spaces we've hosted: Starting your Journey in Web3: Essential Skills and Steps for Newbies (Series): >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1817860969172721834?s=46 https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1814542287164109280?s=46

- We partner with Faculties and Departments in the University to educate and onboard students to Web3 during their Orientation or other programs.

- We were Live at Borderless3.0, not as Guests but we played a Host role in the event. Every Unit had a UNIPORT Member in their team. Social Media Team, Content Team, Media Team, Ushering Team, Developer Team, etc. you can name it. ?>https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337402182652221?s=46

- We have onboarded and trained Newbies who are now experts and are actively educating onboarding newbies into Web3. As a proof of our work, our members volunteered in Gitcoin booth, Bitsave booth, and Movement booth where they were educating and onboarding newbies to Web3: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337406557245794?s=46

- We won the Award of Solidity Developer of the Year and Media Unit Award at Borderless3.0  with both Team Leaders emerging from our Tech Club: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337449658171787?s=46

- We hosted a Picnic in our Campus last year, to welcome many newbies for an unwinding session and onboarded them into Web3: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1799532563238695000?s=46

- Our Members are always Live at Tech Events where they onboard Techies to Web3: >https://x.com/samuelkime5/status/1886408181238096173?s=46

- We did a Web3 Tour on campus to publicize Borderless3.0 and onboarded Newbies to Web3 via Bitsave Protocol: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1847499569682125092?s=46

- We partner with other Tech Communities to volunteer, in their events, be a Speaker and to onboard Newbies into Web3. This was at @ArbitrumPH Event where our Founder educated newbies on Web3 Governance: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839938961445200113?s=46

- We were Live at UNIPORT Parliamentary Week to Educate and onboard the Student Lawmakers on Web3: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1816945860682342552?s=46

- Our Community Members are sought after speakers and Guests in the Tech Community who also onboard newbies during their speaking engagements and most of the Speakers at Borderless3.0, are UNIPORT Students from our Tech Community: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839939043733250109?s=46 >https://x.com/estherpeter_/status/1792933465895104519?s=46

- We educate students on how to leverage the opportunities in Defi, Crypto and Web3 at large. See how much @Debbie got from Pi: >https://x.com/debbie_favy/status/1892551128178429992?s=46

Meet a few of the students we Onboarded that are excelling in their respective fields:

- Nworah Gabriel, (SAGGIO) a Web2 Dev onboarded in Borderless. He is now a Smart Contract Developer and a Solidity Tutor @Borderlesshub: >https://x.com/nworahgabriel?s=21

- Ekeleme Favour (Plutodev) was onboarded as a newbie, and he is currently an Arbitrum Ambassador and a Guardian at ‘Solana All Stars’: >https://x.com/ekelemefavour1?s=21

- Esther Peter, a Law Student we onboarded into the Web3 Space. She's now a Web3 Educator, Creator, Social Media Manager and a Researcher: >https://x.com/estherpeter_?s=21

- Stella is a Law student we onboarded to Web3 last year she is now a Virtual Assistant in the Web3 Space: >https://x.com/ma_ris_st_el_la?s=21

- Jessica is a Biochemistry student in the University of Port Harcourt. We onboarded her to Web3 and taught her UI/UX design during our cipher session: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839938987974086989?s=46

- Debbie is a Medical Student and a newbie we onboarded to Web3 last year. She's now a full-time Web3 Writer: >https://x.com/debbie_favy?s=21


# EXPECTED OUTCOMES
- A fully functional Tech Hub within the university.
- Training of over 100+ students in Web3, blockchain and general tech skills annually.
- Acquisition of facilities for onsite onboarding at the respective faculties and departments.
- Launching of Student's oriented solutions for different faculties in the University.
- Increased student participation in local and global hackathons.
- Stronger partnerships with leading blockchain communities and companies.
- Support for student-led blockchain and tech startups.
data.title: BORDERLESS TECH CLUB, UNIPORT

data.description:
Borderless BUK Kano is a university-based Web3 and blockchain innovation club at Bayero University Kano (BUK), Nigeria. As part of the Borderless Tech Hub Kano initiative, our mission is to drive Web3 education, blockchain innovation, and digital empowerment, equipping students and youth with practical skills in decentralized technologies.

Founded in November 2024, Borderless BUK Kano has actively fostered a thriving Web3 community through three+ physical meetups, interactive online sessions, and hands-on blockchain workshops. Our goal is to create a collaborative ecosystem where students explore DeFi, NFTs, smart contract development, and real-world blockchain applications, positioning them for opportunities in the global digital economy.

And as a club we have had three meeting up.
🔗 https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1853377996851187897?s=19
🔗 https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1882165808505520332?s=19
🔗 https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891114939554619561?s=19

Our Goals & Objectives
 
At Borderless BUK Kano, our primary mission is to enhance Web3 adoption and equip students with practical tech skills. In alignment with our 2025 goals and roadmap, we aim to:

Accelerate Web3 onboarding by providing hands-on learning experiences and practical training in blockchain technology.

Expand community growth and engagement through interactive events, collaborations, and knowledge-sharing sessions.

Foster a strong Web3 ecosystem within Bayero University Kano (BUK) by connecting students to real-world opportunities in decentralized technology.


To achieve these objectives, we host a weekly Telegram session, where we provide structured education on Web3 adoption, blockchain fundamentals, and emerging industry trends for students at BUK.

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1882165808505520332?s=19

Expanding Community & Leadership

At Borderless BUK Kano, we are dedicated to scaling Web3 adoption, fostering community growth, and strengthening partnerships. Recently, we collaborated with OXES, a leading Web3 community at Bayero University Kano (BUK), to enhance networking, engagement, and learning opportunities within the campus.

To streamline Web3 onboarding, tech skill development, and community support, we have established club leaders within the Borderless BUK Tech Club. These leaders play a vital role in educating, mentoring, and consistently following up with members, ensuring continuous growth and hands-on learning experiences.

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1878977686032556159?t=RXFPuKhNcHHuFeLcF8BTrQ&s=19


Contribution to web3

1. Hosted 1 watch party in November 2024 for borderless 3.0

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1853377996851187897?s=19 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1850574294075449527?s=19 


2. We had educational sessions on telegram teaching people about the web3 space in general.
https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1882165808505520332?s=19 


3. Community Meetup @ BUK. We had 84 people onboarded to the web3 space using BYTEONCHAIN educational tool.
https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891111952811757647?s=19 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891113510492385483?s=19 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1891114939554619561?s=19 


4. We were the first borderless tech club that started using BYTEONCHAIN educational tool with 84 attestations @ BUK meetup.

https://x.com/EmmanuelBabade/status1891723077014196629?t=c8lFONmhta-9vHiCyDf-SA&s=19


5. We have successfully built club leaders in BUK already. 

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1878977686032556159?t=RXFPuKhNcHHuFeLcF8BTrQ&s=19

And we are in the process of building club leaders in kano polytechnic institute.

This our move to kano polytechnic institute 
https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1880606293087711443?t=sMyen4zz6QoJkZ_ruLFb-w&s=19


Meet our amazing team members who are making waves in the web3 ecosystem and the ones in training.

https://x.com/borderless_kano/status/1883635538940608587?t=BTozO5C8iJ0USI4gH9GuVQ&s=19

data.description:
ABOUT B<>RDER/ESS WEB3 TECH CLUBS

The B<>rder/ess Tech Club is a strategy for growing Web3 Dev/Tech communities on Campuses.

The B<>rder/ess Tech Clubs are a decentralized community of University Student developers and web3-skilled or aspiring tech-skilled undergraduates and web3 enthusiasts pioneered by the B<>rder/ess Developers Programme and web3 Events.

Our aim is to raise Student Developers from the campuses who by the time they graduate are able to build solutions and projects.


B<>RDER/ESS TECH CLUB STRATEGY
1. Partnerships and collaborations.
2. B<>rder/ess developer program Trainings.
3. Events, Meet-Ups, Campus Tour and Hackathons.
4. Physical Hub set-ups


🤝Partnerships and collaborations:

We start by first partnering with various communities and associations in the School;

- Campus Fellowships
- Student Tech Clubs
- Departmental Associations
and a lot more.

In a case where there are no tech clubs in a University, we start one right away.

See a few of our partnerships: https://borderless.cryptosmartnow.io/updates#:~:text=University%20Community%20Partnerships



👩‍🏫B<>rder/ess developer program Trainings:

The primary purpose of the partnership is to train any community member interested in becoming a developer or learning a tech skill physically or virtually.

These are a few of the stats from our last Cipher Registrations.

 We received applications from over 28 Universities in Nigeria
Over 108 Students applied
 39 Females and 69 Males

Progress Report 
https://x.com/cryptosmartnow/status/1707737634116628621?s=20



👨‍👩‍👦‍👦👩‍💻Events, Meet-Ups, Campus Tours and Hackathons:

Through these activities, we’re able to attract, educate, and inspire young people to pursue career paths in the tech space and in the web3 space.

Our last Campus tour was from October 3rd - October 17th in over 7 different campuses in the South-South.


PROGRESS REPORT FROM OUR LAST CAMPUS TOURS TO ESTABLISH WEB3 TECH CLUBS

data.description: Octant is a platform that enables users to lock GLM, earn ETH rewards, and fund projects they care about.

B<>rder/ess is the Tech Not-For-Profit arm of Crypto Smart, raising 100 web3 developers skilled in Solidity and other web2 tech-skills from the University communities annually for free.

The goal is to raise the next generation of protocol builders, on-chain analysts, Cyber Security experts, Product Designers, UX creatives who'd build Web3 products that can foster adoption.

We do this by establishing physical hubs, hosting events, providing training, offering mentorship, establishing Campus Tech Clubs and launching tech projects.

Learn more and discuss [B<>rder/ess Developers on discuss.octant.app.](https://discuss.octant.app/t/b-rder-ess-developers-program/235)

data.title: BYTE ONCHAIN PRODUCT HOUSE
data.description:
**Product House/5,000 Onchain Value Transactions**

> Dec 2024 - Jan 2025 - Opening A Physical Product House in University of Nigeria Nsukka


1. Leveraging on the B<>rder/ess 3.0 event impact, we kick off cipher sessions for web2 developers and mini incubator programs for businesses that wish to transition to web3.

2. During this program, businesses and developers will team up to build projects that provide RWA B2C value for users in emerging markets, products like OTC trades, Savings, Payment, Fan Arts & Fashion, Logistics and Onchain Invoice Generation and a lot more.

3. We run a Product house so the devs we graduate can collaborate with other builders - project managers, compliance officers, and other tacks to work on projects and build value.


**Expected Immediate Outcome:**
- 6 months of developers and businesses building and deploying.
- 850 Onchain value transactions monthly
- 1 New Project Deployed Monthly

data.text:
**PROGRESS REPORT ON 1ST MILESTONE - B<>rder/ess 3.0:**

We’ve Onboarded 452 Users onchain, with Before and During event Activities and have just kicked off pos event Onboarding activities.

Before and during the event, attendees performed at least one Onchain Attestation, including businesses, web2 developers, Creators & Artists, and general newbies to the web3 ecosystem.

*

> Expected Immediate Outcome form B<>rder/ess 3.0 and Achieved Results:

*

**i. 50 web2 devs onboarded through hackathons and technical sessions:**

Status - DONE ✅
We currently have 52 Developers in our community as a result of this event transitioning to web3 through our cipher session (Post event Activities)


**ii. 100 business owners onboarded through conference discussions and practical sessions.**

Status - IN PROGRESS🚀
- We currently have 23 Businesses who got onboarded through the event.
- We have 77 to go and we’re reaching them through our post event activities targeted at Businesses.



**iii. 200 Non-Crypto native Artists & Creators onboarded through the Public goods concert**

Status - IN PROGRESS🚀
- Through the event we had 109 Creators and Artists onboarded.
- We have 91 to go


**iv. 1,650 Non-Crypto Natives performing at least 1 Onchain attestation including downloading wallets before, during and after B<>rder/ess 3.0**

Status - IN PROGRESS🚀
- Through B<>rder/ess 3.0 we had 268 non-crypto natives onboarded through Public Goods activations like donating during GG22, downloading wallets and performing attestations and more.
- We have 1,382 Non-Crypto Natives to go.



Here’s a full qualitative based report on the event, including how much value we brought to the Octant Ecosystem.
https://x.com/_karlagod/status/1855292021063254331?t=X4T7MxM1OYx9NaRMlNYcyQ&s=19

> Platforms Launched as a result of B<>rder/ess 3.0

1. byteonchain.news
2. byteonchain.xyz (in progress 70% done)

We’ve launched the Byte Onchain News Platform that spotlights Public Goods activities, projects, builders, concepts and a lot more, here are some articles we’ve spotlighted;
https://byteonchain.news/deep-dive-a-break-down-of-streaming-quadratic-funding-sqf/

**Byte Onchain Awards and Public Goods Concert**
We had Awards activities to encourage Public Good contributors and funders in the web3 ecosystem.
https://byteonchain.news/category/news/events-diary/

That Concludes our first Milestones, funding activities will go towards achieving our 2nd milestone which is the Byte Onchain Product House.

questions.query: Email Address
Team Size
Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
Partnership Agreement: Intended Deliverables / Milestones
ReFi Web3 Awareness, Adoption, & Development
Deliverable: Organize ReFi Web3 Developer Bootcamps across university hubs to train new builders on regenerative finance applications.
Contribution: Expand onboarding and educational content on byteonchain.xyz to introduce more developers and users to ReFi tools, quadratic funding, and sustainable Web3 models.
Collaboration: Work with ReFi ecosystem partners to host ReFi hackathons and incentivize builders to create impactful solutions.
Celo, Ethereum & Ecosystem Activity
Deliverable: Develop ReFi-focused onboarding toolkits for university students and grassroots organizations to adopt blockchain-based financial systems (using Celo, Ethereum & L2s).
Contribution: Conduct research and create case studies on how Celo & Ethereum are being used in grassroots economies for regenerative finance.
Collaboration: Partner with ReFi DAOs, dApps, and grant programs to fund and support developers working on ReFi projects.
Local Ecological, Social, and Economic Impact
Deliverable: Pilot micro-grants & ReFi-based circular economies within university and local communities to test models of blockchain-powered local impact.
Contribution: Implement an on-chain public goods leaderboard to track and reward local ReFi initiatives, creating transparency and engagement.
Collaboration: Work with impact DAOs, carbon credit projects, and on-chain funding protocols to provide real-world applications for ReFi tools in underserved regions.
Content, Storytelling & Outreach (support)
Deliverable: Produce ReFi-focused explainer videos & educational campaigns to increase adoption among new users, builders, and local changemakers.
Contribution: Leverage B<>rder/ess media platforms (ByteOnchain Podcast, Twitter, YouTube) to showcase success stories and best practices in ReFi adoption and public goods funding.

data.title: Content, Storytelling & Outreach (support)
data.description:
**Deliverable:** Produce ReFi-focused explainer videos & educational campaigns to increase adoption among new users, builders, and local changemakers.

**Contribution:** Leverage B<>rder/ess media platforms (ByteOnchain Podcast, Twitter, YouTube) to showcase success stories and best practices in ReFi adoption and public goods funding.

data.title: Local Ecological, Social, and Economic Impact
data.description:
**Deliverable:** Pilot micro-grants & ReFi-based circular economies within university and local communities to test models of blockchain-powered local impact.

**Contribution:** Implement an on-chain public goods leaderboard to track and reward local ReFi initiatives, creating transparency and engagement.

**Collaboration:** Work with impact DAOs, carbon credit projects, and on-chain funding protocols to provide real-world applications for ReFi tools in underserved regions.

data.title: Celo, Ethereum & Ecosystem Activity
data.description:
**Deliverable:** Develop ReFi-focused onboarding toolkits for university students and grassroots organizations to adopt blockchain-based financial systems (using Celo, Ethereum & L2s).

**Contribution:** Conduct research and create case studies on how Celo & Ethereum are being used in grassroots economies for regenerative finance.

**Collaboration:** Partner with ReFi DAOs, dApps, and grant programs to fund and support developers working on ReFi projects.

data.title: ReFi Web3 Awareness, Adoption, & Development
data.description:
**Deliverable:** Organize ReFi Web3 Developer Bootcamps across university hubs to train new builders on regenerative finance applications.

**Contribution:** Expand onboarding and educational content on byteonchain.xyz to introduce more developers and users to ReFi tools, quadratic funding, and sustainable Web3 models.

**Collaboration:** Work with ReFi ecosystem partners to host ReFi hackathons and incentivize builders to create impactful solutions.

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.

data.title: Global Stablecoin Hackathon
data.description:
Borderless Yield — Project Milestones

Milestone 1: Setup & Smart Contract

[x] Project folder structure created

[x] Basic lending smart contract written (BorderlessLending.sol)

[ ] Celo testnet config + .env for deployment

[ ] Smart contract deployed to Celo Alfajores testnet


Milestone 2: Frontend MVP

[ ] Create React frontend (investor + borrower views)

[ ] Connect wallet (Celo Extension Wallet or MetaMask)

[ ] Interact with deployed contract (fund & repay loan)


Milestone 3: Stablecoin Integration

[ ] Use testnet cUSD as the loan currency

[ ] Display balances, transfer confirmations, etc.


Milestone 4: GitHub & Docs

[ ] Upload full code to GitHub

[ ] Add README with setup instructions

[ ] Add smart contract ABI + deployment address


Milestone 5: Pitch Materials

[ ] Create pitch deck (Problem, Solution, Demo, Impact)

[ ] Record 1–2 min demo video (if required)

[ ] Submit to hackathon

milestones.title: Milestone 1: Foundation Setup
milestones.description:
Goal: Prepare the core structure

Set up GitHub repo

Define project scope & roles

Create wireframes for investor & borrower flow

Choose Arbitrum testnet (e.g., Arbitrum Sepolia)

data.title: Milestone 2: Smart Contract MVP
data.description:
Goal: Deploy core lending logic

Build & test lending contract (basic fund → repay)

Deploy to Arbitrum testnet

Simulate stablecoin transfers (mock or testnet tokens)

data.title: Milestone 1: Foundation Setup

Goal: Prepare the core structure

Set up GitHub repo

Define project scope & roles

Choose Arbitrum testnet (e.g., Arbitrum Sepolia)

data.text:
Grant Work Summary

Borderless Yield is a decentralized micro-investment platform that enables diaspora communities to invest in local businesses and individuals using local stablecoins (e.g., $cKES, $cCOP, $cNGN). Through this grant, we successfully:

Defined and structured the platform’s core milestones

Developed smart contract logic for peer-to-peer lending on Arbitrum One

Built a frontend interface enabling wallet connection, investment, and repayment tracking

Created a sustainable business model focused on real-world impact in high-remittance regions like Kenya, Nigeria, and Colombia

Drafted a pitch deck and project documentation for scaling and partnerships



---

Experience Working on the Grant

Working on this grant has been both challenging and rewarding. It involved:

Deep research into cross-border finance, local stablecoins, and DeFi lending models

Coordinated team collaboration across tech and strategy domains

Fast iteration to meet hackathon and prototype deadlines

Exposure to Layer 2 ecosystems like Arbitrum and user needs in emerging markets


This process helped sharpen our technical, UX, and business strategy execution under tight timelines.


---

Potential Impact

Borderless Yield can redefine how remittances work—turning them from one-time transfers into long-term investments.
The platform has the potential to:

Empower local entrepreneurs with access to affordable, stablecoin-based capital

Give diaspora communities new tools to support their home countries while earning

Reduce reliance on exploitative middlemen in traditional remittance and loan systems

Expand financial inclusion through DeFi in underbanked regions


With continued development and partnerships, this project could significantly improve access to capital, drive local innovation, and build cross-border economic bridges.

questions.query: Email Address
Which B<>rder/ess University Web3 Tech Club are you affiliated with and state the web3 Tech Club Leads name?
questions.explanation: This is B<>rderless Tech Club, Uniport. Esther Peter is the Tech Club Lead.

questions.query: Give a summary of your project or your work as an individual, include impact measurement reports (Qualitative & Quantitative).
questions.explanation:
Borderless Tech Club, Uniport is a subset of the B<>rder/ess Dev Hub. This club was created with the aim of training, equipping and empowering young persons in the University of Port Harcourt with Web3 Education, onboarding and in-demand Tech skills.

The Club was established in 2023 and since inception, Borderless UNIPORT, has been very instrumental in the Web3 Education of the University Students. This is the foremost Tech Club in the university when it comes to Web3 onboarding. Annually, over 20 students in Uniport graduate from our cipher sessions where they learn in demand Tech and Web3 skills which includes; Data Analysis, Smart Contract Development, Solidity, Web Development, UI/IX, Cyber Security etc.

# OUR IMPACT
As a Tech Club we have an active WhatsApp community of 240 UNIPORT Students we have onboarded into the Web3 Space. We do this via:

Hosting Virtual Onboarding Sessions on X Spaces. Here is a few links to the X Spaces we've hosted: Starting your Journey in Web3: Essential Skills and Steps for Newbies (Series): https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1817860969172721834?s=46 https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1814542287164109280?s=46

We partner with Faculties and Departments in the University to educate and onboard students to Web3 during their Orientation or other programs.

We were Live at Borderless3.0, not as Guests but we played a Host role in the event. Every Unit had a UNIPORT Member in their team. Social Media Team, Content Team, Media Team, Ushering Team, Developer Team, etc. you can name it. https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337402182652221?s=46

We have onboarded and trained Newbies who are now experts and are actively educating onboarding newbies into Web3. As a proof of our work, our members volunteered in Gitcoin booth, Bitsave booth, and Movement booth where they were educating and onboarding newbies to Web3: https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337406557245794?s=46

We won the Award of Solidity Developer of the Year and Media Unit Award with both Team Leaders emerging from our Tech Club: https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1855337449658171787?s=46

We hosted a Picnic in our Campus last year, to welcome many newbies for an unwinding session and onboarded them into Web3: https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1799532563238695000?s=46

Our Members are always Live at Tech Events where they onboard Techies to Web3: https://x.com/samuelkime5/status/1886408181238096173?s=46

We did a Web3 Tour on campus to publicize Borderless3.0 and onboarded Newbies to Web3 via Bitsave Protocol: https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1847499569682125092?s=46

We partner with other Tech Communities to volunteer, in their events, be a Speaker and to onboard Newbies into Web3. This was at @ArbitrumPH Event where our Founder educated newbies on Web3 Governance: https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839938961445200113?s=46

We were Live at UNIPORT Parliamentary Week to Educate and onboard the Student Lawmakers on Web3: https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1816945860682342552?s=46

Our Community Members are sought after speakers and Guests in the Tech Community who also onboard newbies during their speaking engagements and most of the Speakers at Borderless3.0, are UNIPORT Students from our Tech Community: https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839939043733250109?s=46 https://x.com/estherpeter_/status/1792933465895104519?s=46

We educate students on how to leverage the opportunities in Defi, Crypto and Web3 at large. See how much @Debbie got from Pi: https://x.com/debbie_favy/status/1892551128178429992?s=46

Meet some of the students we Onboarded that are Trailing Blaizes in the Web3 field:

Nworah Gabriel, (SAGGIO) a Web2 Dev onboarded in Borderless. He is now a Smart Contract Developer and a Solidity Tutor @Borderlesshub: >https://x.com/nworahgabriel?s=21

Ekeleme Favour (Plutodev) was onboarded as a newbie, and he is currently an Arbitrum Ambassador and a Guardian at ‘Solana All Stars’: >https://x.com/ekelemefavour1?s=21

Esther Peter, a Law Student we onboarded into the Web3 Space. She's now a Web3 Educator, Creator, Social Media Manager and a Researcher: >https://x.com/estherpeter_?s=21

Stella is a Law student we onboarded to Web3 last year she is now a Virtual Assistant in the Web3 Space: >https://x.com/ma_ris_st_el_la?s=21

Jessica a Biochemistry student in the University of Port Harcourt. We onboarded her to Web3 and taught her UI/UX design during our cipher session: >https://x.com/borderless_ph/status/1839938987974086989?s=46

Debbie is a Medical Student and a newbie we onboarded to Web3 last year. She's now a full-time Web3 Writer: >https://x.com/debbie_favy?s=21 recently, Debbie emerged one of the front row Winner of the ScribbleDao Writeathon contest. >https://x.com/debbie_favy/status/1902820996475765196?s=46

Email Address
Which B<>rder/ess University Web3 Tech Club are you affiliated with and state the web3 Tech Club Leads name?
questions.explanation: We are borderless Tech club BUK kano

questions.query: Give a summary of your project or your work as an individual, include impact measurement reports (Qualitative & Quantitative).
questions.explanation:
Borderless BUK Kano is a university-based Web3 and blockchain innovation club at Bayero University Kano (BUK), Nigeria.

Mission: Drive Web3 education, blockchain innovation, and digital empowerment.

Goals:

1. Enhance Web3 adoption
2. Equip students with practical tech skills
3. Foster a strong Web3 ecosystem

Achievements:

1. Hosted 3+ physical meetups and online sessions
2. Collaborated with OXES, a leading Web3 community
3. Established club leaders for education and mentorship
4. Contributed to Web3 through watch parties, educational sessions, and community meetups

Impact: Empowering students and youth with practical skills in decentralized technologies.
